questions.question: Measles ……………………….. contagious.
questions.description: The names of illnesses are usually uncountable in English and hence they take singular verbs.

questions.question: Mathematics ……………………….. my favorite subject.
questions.description: The nouns science, mathematics and physics are singular.

questions.question: I …………………………. my professor yesterday.
questions.description: To call on is to visit.

questions.question: Either of these roads …………………………. to the railway station.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: I ……………………….. in Mumbai from 2001 to
questions.description: Use the simple past to talk about finished events.

questions.question: Five applications …………………………. by the management.
questions.description: In the simple past, the passive form is made with was/were + past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: They are decorating the hall for the party. The hall ……………………………….. by them for the party.
questions.description: The passive form of the present continuous is made with is/am/are + being + past participle.

questions.question: They waited with ………………………… breath.
questions.description: Bated breath means to hold one’s breath.

questions.question: She ……………………………. on that project for six months.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: It …………………………… raining since yesterday.
questions.description: It hasn’t stopped raining means the same as it has been raining.
